question: a shopkeeper sold an article offering a discount of 5 % and earned a profit of 19.7 % . what would have been the percentage of profit earned if no discount was offered ?

one hour after yolanda started walking from x to y , a distance of 40 miles , bob started walking along the same road from y to x . if yolanda â s walking rate was 2 miles per hour and bob â s was 4 miles per hour , how many miles had bob walked when they met ?

the walker walking at a constant rate of 4 miles per hour is passed by a cyclist traveling in the same direction along the same path at 20 miles per hour . the cyclist stops to wait for the hiker 5 minutes after passing her , while the walker continues to walk at her constant rate , how many minutes must the cyclist wait until the walker catches up ?
find the l . c . m of 2 / 15 , 3 / 10 , 6 / 5

two bullet train s 140 m and 170 m long run at the speed of 60 km / hr and 40 km / hr respectively in opposite directions on parallel tracks . the time ( in seconds ) which they take to cross each other , is :
running at the same constant rate , 6 identical machines can produce a total of 270 bottles per minute . at this rate , how many bottles could 16 such machines produce in 4 minutes ?
if 6 pr = 360 and if 6 cr = 15 , find r ?
j is 25 % less than p and 20 % less than t . t is x % less than p . what is the value of x ?

if 15 % of 40 is greater than 25 % of a number by 2 , the number is

a man started driving at a constant speed , from the site of a blast , the moment he heard the blast . he heard a second blast after a time of 30 mins and 24 seconds . if the second blast occurred exactly 30 mins after the first , how many meters was he from the site when he heard the second blast ? ( speed of sound = 330 m / s )
calculate the ratio between x and y if 80 % of x equal to 20 % of y ?
the sum of three consecutive even numbers is 30 . find the middle number of the three ?

two cars a and b start from boston and new york respectively simultaneously and travel towards each other at constant speeds along the same route . after meeting at a point between boston and new york the two cars a and b proceed to their respective destinations of new york and boston . car a reaches new york 10 minutes after the two cars have met and car b reaches boston 90 minutes after they have met . how long did car a take to cover the distance between boston and new york ?
if 12401 is divided by any no . then quotient is 76 and remainder is 13 . what is divisor ?
the radius of the two circular fields is in the ratio 3 : 10 the area of the first field is what percent less than the area of the second ?

a discount electronics store normally sells all merchandise at a discount of 10 percent to 30 percent off the suggested retail price . if , during a special sale , an additional 20 percent were to be deducted from the discount price , what would be the lowest possible price of an item costing $ 200 before any discount ?
there is 60 % increase in an amount in 6 years at si . what will be the ci of rs . 13,000 after 3 years at the same rate ?
if 1 tic equals 4 tacs and 5 tacs equal 8 tocs , what is the ratio of one tic to one toc ?
the area of a square is equal to seven times the area of a rectangle of dimensions 25 cm * 343 cm . what is the perimeter of the square ?
a waiter ' s salary consists of his salary and tips . during one week his tips were 9 / 4 of his salary . what fraction of his income came from tips ?
dawson has to secure 30 % marks to clear his exam of class 8 th . he got 30 marks and failed by 36 marks . what is the maximum marks ?
the ratio of two quantities is 1 to 2 . if each of the quantities is increased by 15 , what is the ratio of these 2 new quantities ?

on rainy mornings , mo drinks exactly n cups of hot chocolate ( assume that n is an integer ) . on mornings that are not rainy , mo drinks exactly 2 cups of tea . last week mo drank a total of 16 cups of tea and hot chocolate together . if during that week mo drank 4 more tea cups than hot chocolate cups , then how many rainy days were there last week ?

village x has a population of 70000 , which is decreasing at the rate of 1200 per year . village y has a population of 42000 , which is increasing at the rate of 800 per year . in how many years will the population of the two villages be equal ?

two circular signs are to be painted . if the diameter of the larger sign is 7 times that of the smaller sign , how many times more paint is needed to paint the larger sign ? ( we can assume that a given amount of paint covers the same area on both signs . )

two friends decide to get together ; so they start riding bikes towards each other . they plan to meet halfway . each is riding at 6 mph . they live 36 miles apart . one of them has a pet carrier pigeon and it starts flying the instant the friends start traveling . the pigeon flies back and forth at 40 mph between the 2 friends until the friends meet . how many miles does the pigeon travel ?
$ 350 is divided among a , b , and c so that a receives half as much as b , and b receives half as much as c . how much money is c ' s share ?
i gain 70 paise on rs . 70 . my gain percent is :
the sector of a circle has radius of 21 cm and central angle 45 o . find its perimeter ?
the length of a train and that of a platform are equal . if with a speed of 72 k / hr , the train crosses the platform in one minute , then the length of the train ( in meters ) is ?

in a graduating class of 232 students , 144 took geometry and 119 took biology . what is the difference between the greatest possible number and the smallest possible number of students that could have taken both geometry and biology ?
the length of a rectangle is halved , while its breadth is tripled . what is the % change in area ?
in a 400 member association consisting of men and women , exactly 20 % of men and exactly 25 % women are homeowners . what is the least number of members who are homeowners ?

find the ratio in which wheat of inferior quality ( rs . 14 / kg ) be mixed with wheat of superior quality ( rs . 28 / kg ) so that the shopkeeper gains rs . 2 by selling the resulting mixture at rs . 20 / kg .
the least number which must be subtracted from 6709 to make it exactly divisible by 9 is :
a rectangular floor is covered by a rug except for a strip 2 meters wide along each of the four edge . if the floor is 10 meters by 8 meters , what is the area of the rug in square meters ?

tough and tricky questions : probability . medical analysts predict that a quarter of all people who are infected by a certain biological agent could be expected to be killed for each day that passes during which they have not received an antidote . what fraction of a group of 1000 people could be expected to be killed if infected and not treated for 3 full days ?
a number is said to be prime saturated if the product of all the different positive prime factors of a is less than the square root of a . what is the greatest two digit prime saturated integer ?
a room 11 m 47 cm long and 7 m 77 cm broad is to be paved with square tiles . find the least number of square tiles required to cover the floor .
a ratio between two numbers is 3 : 4 and their l . c . m . is 180 . the first number is
mary ' s income is 70 percent more than tim ' s income , and tim ' s income is 40 percent less than juan ' s income . what percent of juan ' s income is mary ' s income ?
find the expenditure on digging a well 14 m deep and of 3 m diameter at rs . 17 per cubic meter ?
pipe a can fill a tank in 2 hours . due to a leak at the bottom , it takes 4 hours for the pipe a to fill the tank . in what time can the leak alone empty the full tank ?

a cricket player whose bowling average was 24.50 runs per wicket , takes 5 wicket for 52 runs in a match . due to this his average decreases by 0.50 . what will be the number of wickets taken by him till the last match ?

tom , working alone , can paint a room in 8 hours . peter and john , working independently , can paint the same room in 4 hours and 2 hours , respectively . tom starts painting the room and works on his own for two hour . he is then joined by peter and they work together for two hour . finally , john joins them and the three of them work together to finish the room , each one working at his respective rate . what fraction of the whole job was done by peter ?
if p is a prime number greater than 3 , find the remainder when p ^ 2 + 16 is divided by 12 .
fresh grapes contain 75 % water by weight and raisins obtained by drying fresh grapes contain 25 % water by weight . how many kgs of fresh grapes are needed to get 25 kgs of raisins ?
a circular path of 20 m radius has marginal walk 2 m wide all round it . find the cost of leveling the walk at 25 p per m 2 ?
